engine_status: WARNING — STALLING RISK: Zero PURSUE verdicts in 9 cycles. Two overdue critical questions must resolve in Cycle 10 or engine enters analysis paralysis.
summary: Cycle 9 brought the engine's most significant methodological advance (bottom-up sector screener producing 3 new candidates from 933 sectors) and its most sobering assessment: the engine has never produced a PURSUE verdict. Of 6 opportunity clusters verified, 3 survived as INVESTIGATE_FURTHER and 3 were PARKED. LATAM Nearshoring parked after 3 cycles of failed differentiation from BPO incumbents — LATAM talent reframed as competitive advantage for Customer Support Vacuum, not standalone opportunity. Boutique Consulting parked for K-002 proximity (trust/relationship sale barrier). Dental parked for regulatory barriers and poor founder fit. Customer Support Vacuum remains #1 with strongest multi-dimensional thesis support but OVERDUE service layer density verification. Veterinary remains #2 with unique sparse density but OVERDUE Mars/IDEXX threat assessment. Wholesale Trade AI Broker is the genuine novel discovery — pure Coasean intermediation target — but needs K-004 distinction test. The engine must RESOLVE OR DECIDE in Cycle 10: either answer the overdue questions or make a judgment call with incomplete information. Analysis paralysis is now a greater risk than making a wrong decision.

top_opportunities.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler — Managed Hybrid Human+AI
top_opportunities.thesis: Companies prematurely cutting human support (Klarna reversal) while AI-only fails. Staffing canary (-51% RHI) market-confirms professional labor substitution. Tool layer saturated (Intercom, Zendesk) but SERVICE layer (managed hybrid) density is the CRITICAL UNKNOWN. AI-first with human escalation at 40-60% cost of pure-human, 10x reliability of pure-AI.
key_strengths: Precedent failure confirmation (Klarna, Air Canada, NEDA)
Favorable unit economics (AI handles 60-70% Tier 1, humans escalation only)
Good founder fit (no credentials needed, LATAM talent pipeline for human agents)
key_risks: OVERDUE: Service layer density unresolved since Cycle 8
BPO incumbents (Concentrix $5.4B, TTEC $2.1B, Teleperformance ~$8B) adding AI
AI-native support startups (Sierra AI, Decagon, Parloa) blurring tool/service line
Window narrowing: 12-18 months before BPO firms offer similar AI-first models
top_opportunities.critical_action: MUST resolve service layer density in Cycle 10. If <$500M deployed in AI-native managed services: PURSUE. If >$1B: PARK.
top_opportunities.vc_hook: Robert Half lost 51% of its value because companies are cutting professional staff. But Klarna tried going all-AI and reversed in months. We fill the gap at 40% cheaper than all-human, actually works unlike all-AI. Market is telling you this is real.
top_opportunities.founder_competitive_advantage: LATAM talent pipeline (Argentina founder) provides human agents at 30-50% US cost. AI/ML founder builds the AI layer. Combined: AI-first + LATAM humans = lowest cost hybrid support provider.

top_opportunities.name: Veterinary Services — Agentic Practice Operations
top_opportunities.thesis: 33K US vet practices with 60-70% labor costs, sparse competitive density ($200-400M vs $3-5B+ everywhere else). Most states allow non-vet ownership. Software-only model viable at $500K-$1M. Mars Petcare consolidation is the existential threat — but Mars buys practices, not software.
key_strengths: Sparsest competitive density in entire pipeline ($200-400M)
Most states allow non-vet ownership (unlike dental 38-state restriction)
Baumol cost disease confirmed (60-70% labor costs rising)
key_risks: OVERDUE: Mars/IDEXX threat assessment unresolved since Cycle 7
Archy ($47M) positioned as first-mover in practice operations
Small TAM ($200-400M) may limit VC follow-on
P5 Labor Gap at 0.4 weakens demographic thesis — must prove vet-specific gap
Score decaying for staleness (3 cycles without advancement)
top_opportunities.critical_action: MUST resolve Mars/IDEXX threat in Cycle 10. If not building practice ops AI: PURSUE with software model. If building: PARK.
top_opportunities.vc_hook: 33K fragmented vet practices with 60-70% labor costs. Every other sector we scanned had $3B+ VC deployed — vet has $200M. Healthcare worker wages surging 20% — vet practices feel it too but have zero AI solution.
top_opportunities.founder_competitive_advantage: ML/AI founder builds practice operations AI. Low regulatory barrier (most states allow non-vet ownership). Software-only model = capital-efficient at $500K-$1M.

top_opportunities.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker — NAICS 425120
top_opportunities.thesis: 512K employees in 122K firms (avg 4.2 emp), pure intermediaries with zero inventory. 100% coordination value = pure Coasean collapse target. B2B marketplaces (Chemdex/Covisint) failed in dot-com era but AI 100x cheaper now. Dead business revival candidate with LOW competitive density.
key_strengths: Discovered by bottom-up screener (not LLM brainstorm retread)
Pure intermediation: no inventory, no logistics, just matching
Dead business revival pattern (failed in 2000, viable now)
key_risks: K-004 (freight brokerage) proximity — relationship moat may apply
Two-sided marketplace cold start problem at $500K-$1M
Chemdex/Covisint failed for relationship reasons, not just tech cost
Behavioral inertia: buyers/sellers prefer known brokers
Must identify correct vertical (commoditized goods where relationships weak)
top_opportunities.critical_action: Write 'Why wholesale is not freight' distinction memo. If unconvincing: PARK.
top_opportunities.vc_hook: The dot-com B2B marketplace thesis was right but too early. Coordination costs are 100x lower now. We target the most fragmented wholesale trade segments where agents add zero operational value, only matching. Pure Coasean collapse play.
top_opportunities.founder_competitive_advantage: ML/AI founder can build AI matching engine. Low regulatory barriers. But no domain expertise in wholesale trade — would need vertical-specific advisor.

top_opportunities.name: LATAM Nearshoring + AI Augmentation
top_opportunities.park_reason: Cannot differentiate from BPO incumbents ($10B+ Concentrix, TTEC, Teleperformance). Globant ($2B, headquartered in Argentina) IS this thesis. After 3 cycles of analysis, the differentiation has not become clearer — it has become blurrier as BPO firms add AI. LATAM talent advantage reframed as competitive moat for Customer Support Vacuum, not standalone opportunity.
top_opportunities.reactivation_trigger: Specific professional services vertical identified where no LATAM BPO operates + no credential requirement + $500M+ TAM. High bar unlikely to be met.

top_opportunities.name: Dental Practice Operations AI
top_opportunities.park_reason: 38 states restrict dental practice ownership. Archy $47M first-mover. Dentrix/Eaglesoft incumbents will add AI. PE-backed DSO consolidators building centralized platforms. Poorest founder-market fit in pipeline.
top_opportunities.reactivation_trigger: Dental operations AI confirmed <$200M deployed + DSO regulatory path viable at $500K-$1M + Dentrix NOT building AI features.

top_opportunities.name: Boutique Management Consulting Replacement
top_opportunities.park_reason: K-002 (SMB back-office) proximity. Consulting is a trust/relationship sale that AI cannot replicate. Accenture $3B+ AI investments compressing from above. No scalable distribution channel. Unit economics likely fail at scale (Bench/Pilot lesson applies). One more cycle of failed differentiation should escalate to KILL.
top_opportunities.reactivation_trigger: Specific standardized consulting sub-vertical identified with procurement-driven (not relationship-driven) buying + no existing AI service + $500M+ TAM.

key_patterns.description: P3 Cost Collapse (100.0) and Capital Environment (100.0) both at historic maximum. Most favorable macro for AI-native business formation ever measured. BUT creates density risk as capital floods all sectors.
Staffing stocks (RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20%) confirm structural professional labor substitution. Equity markets leading government data by 6-12 months.
Companies cutting humans (staffing -51%) while AI-only fails (Klarna reversal). Hybrid human+AI fills the gap. Window: 12-18 months.
Tool layer saturated across all sectors. Service layer density is the make-or-break filter. Must verify empirically for each surviving opportunity.

Business applications -69.7% despite maximum favorable conditions. Entrepreneurs NOT forming businesses. This means competitive landscape remains sparse — but also means our opportunities may face slower adoption.

Every sector the Principles Engine flags has attracted $1B+ VC/PE. Only vet ($200-400M) and possibly wholesale trade (unverified) pass the density filter. The engine's framework identifies obvious disruption — but obvious disruption is obvious to everyone.
P2 Liquidation Pressure at 0.0 despite labor substitution. Incumbents adapting, not dying. Favors greenfield entry over distressed acquisition.
key_patterns.cycle_status: confirmed — strategy implication: build, don't buy

parks_this_cycle.name: LATAM Nearshoring + AI Augmentation
parks_this_cycle.reason: BPO incumbent density ($10B+). Globant IS this thesis. Cannot differentiate after 3 cycles. Reframed as competitive advantage for Customer Support, not standalone opportunity.

parks_this_cycle.name: Boutique Management Consulting Replacement
parks_this_cycle.reason: K-002 proximity. Trust/relationship sale barrier. Accenture $3B+ AI compression from above. No scalable distribution. Approaching kill threshold.

parks_this_cycle.name: Dental Practice Operations AI
parks_this_cycle.reason: 38-state ownership restriction. Archy $47M first-mover. DSO incumbents building centralized platforms. Poorest founder-market fit in pipeline.

methodology_notes: Cycle 9's most valuable methodological contribution was the bottom-up BLS/Census sector screener, which broke the LLM brainstorming exhaustion problem by mechanically screening 933 NAICS sectors. This produced wholesale trade AI brokerage — a category never previously considered. Competitive density scanning remains the single most valuable filter (every opportunity that passed it has stayed viable). Counter-signal research drove 3 parks. NEW RECOMMENDATION: Add customer discovery interviews as a methodology. The engine has been purely desk-research for 9 cycles. At this stage, 5-10 customer conversations would provide more signal than another data analysis cycle. IO table propagation and shift-share decomposition remain unused (0 applications) — Thompson Sampling should force trials in Cycle 10-11.
next_cycle_priorities: PRIORITY 1 (NON-NEGOTIABLE): Resolve customer support SERVICE layer competitive density. Search for AI-native managed support companies. Map funding. If <$500M deployed: advance Customer Support to PURSUE. If >$1B: PARK. THIS CANNOT WAIT ANOTHER CYCLE.

PRIORITY 2 (NON-NEGOTIABLE): Resolve Mars/IDEXX veterinary threat. Check job postings, press releases, product roadmaps. If not building practice ops AI: advance Vet to PURSUE. If building: PARK. OVERDUE SINCE CYCLE 7.
PRIORITY 3: Write wholesale trade distinction memo vs K-004 (freight). If unconvincing: PARK.
PRIORITY 4: Add customer discovery interviews as methodology. Conduct 5-10 calls for top opportunity.
PRIORITY 5: Thompson Sampling trial of IO table propagation (untested, 0 applications).
PRIORITY 6: Establish explicit PURSUE threshold — what confidence level is required? Decide at beginning of Cycle 10.

META-PRIORITY: The engine must produce at least ONE PURSUE verdict by Cycle 12 or the founders should question the engine's value model. Analysis paralysis is now a greater risk than making a wrong decision.

staffing_canary.status: CONFIRMED — professional labor substitution market-priced. Monitor quarterly.

entries.reason: Federal law prohibits core value proposition

approaching_kill.reason: K-002 proximity, trust/relationship barrier. One more cycle of failed differentiation triggers kill.

Bottom-up screener breakthrough. 3 new candidates, 3 new parks. LATAM parked. Stalling warning issued.
